afb-service.description: AFB service from where comes the signals values

latitude.description: expresses the latitude of the current position. Range [-90:+90]. Example: 48.053250

longitude.description: expresses the longitude of the current position. Range [-180:+180]. Example: 8.324500

altitude.description: expresses the altitude above the sea level of the current position in meters

heading.description: expresses the course angle in degree. Range [0:360]. 0 = north, 90 = east, 180 = south, 270 = west

speed.description: expresses speed measured in m/s. A negative value indicates that the vehicle is moving backwards

climb.description: that expresses the road gradient in degrees

roll_rate.description: rotation rate around the x-axis in degrees/s. range [-100:+100]

pitch_rate.description: rotation rate around the y-axis in degrees/s. range [-100:+100]

yaw_rate.description: rotation rate around the z-axis in degrees/s. range [-100:+100]

pdop.description: that represents the positional (3d) dilution of precision

hdop.description: that represents the horizontal (2d) dilution of precision

vdop.description: that represents vertical (altitude) dilution of precision

used_satellites.description: that represents the number of used satellites

tracked_satellites.description: that represents the number of tracked satellites

visible_satellites.description: that represents the number of visible satellites

sigma_hposition.description: that represents the standard deviation for the horizontal position in m

sigma_altitude.description: that represents the standard deviation for altitude in m

sigma_heading.description: that represents the standard deviation for altitude in degrees

sigma_speed.description: that represents the standard error estimate of the speed in m/s</line>

sigma_climb.description: that represents the standard error estimate of the climb in degrees</line>

dr_status.description: where true means that a dead-reckoning algorithm has been used to calculate the current position

reliabilty_index.description: percentage that indicates the position feedback reliability. It can assume values from 0 to 100. Higher values indicate higher reliability.

isDoorOpen.description: the door state; set to 'true' if the door is open

isWindowOpen.description: the window state of this door; set to 'true' if window is open; set to JSON-undefined if window state is unknown or invalid

speed.description: vehicle centerpoint speed as shown by the instrument cluster
